speciesPhotos.alt: A translucent green glass frog showing its internal organs through its belly

funFacts.title: See-Through Skin
funFacts.description: You can see their heart, liver, and intestines through their transparent belly!

funFacts.title: Super Dads
funFacts.description: Male glass frogs guard their eggs, keeping them moist and safe from predators.

funFacts.title: Waterfall Homes
funFacts.description: They live near streams and waterfalls in cloud forests high in the mountains.

funFacts.title: Night Singers
funFacts.description: They're nocturnal and call at night with a high-pitched whistle.

researcher.name: Luis Coloma
researcher.quote: Glass frogs are like tiny windows into the natural world. Their transparent bodies remind us how amazing and delicate life can be.
researcher.story: Luis runs the Jambatu Center in Ecuador, where he and his team work to save some of the world's most endangered frogs. He's discovered several new species and has helped bring some back from the edge of extinction!
